title.rendered: More on The Shared Economy: For Millennials, Shared Living is Becoming a New Way of Life

content.rendered:
FROM HUFFINGTON POST:  Once, living with roommates or housemates was a necessary way station between dorm life and settling down to buy a family home. Now, shared living is a bona fide life stage not only for millennials, but increasingly for Americans of all ages.

Shared living can mean anything from standard shared apartments to shared houses or even the furnished, flexible co-living spaces of WeLive and similar brands. Read more here.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Help! I’m Stuck Coliving In Quarantine With Roommates I Don’t Like
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: So you’re stuck coliving in the pandemic with a roommate you don’t particularly like. You have likely arrived here looking for an exit strategy from your shared apartment. Maybe a search for new apartments with roommates has already begun. Or perhaps you are at your wits' end and are now…

img.alt_text: shared living spaces, shared apartments, coliving, apartments with roommates

jetpack-related-posts.title: Your Guide For Shared Apartment In NYC
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: It’s okay to feel confused on where to start when it comes to shared apartment hunting, especially in NYC. You have all these chaotic stream of questions like “where to begin? how to find someone to share an apartment? how to be within budget?” and so on. Here, at Roomi,…

img.alt_text: roommates living in a shared apartment nyc

jetpack-related-posts.title: The Habits That Put You In The ‘Annoying Roommate’ Zone
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: We've learned a lot this year! One of the highlights though has been ironing out the rough edges of communal living in a shared living space. If you think your roomis are the best and you have no complaints, well, you're one of the lucky ones! However, when we practice…

img.alt_text: person annoyed in a communal shared living space

jetpack-related-posts.title: A Guide to Shared Living: Getting Along with Your Housemates and Accepting Their Habits
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Although living with a roommate is awesome for the most part, shared living can be challenging sometimes. Initially, moving out of your parent's home seems wonderful. Additionally, you romanticize being best buds with your new roomies, getting home at whatever time you like without having to sneak in, and having…

img.alt_text: A man and a woman arguing with each other

jetpack-related-posts.title: The Real Difference in Co-Living vs. Living With Roommates | Part 2
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Changes in living spaces have been a long time coming. It is predicted that offices of the future will be a blended system. A marriage of co-working and co-living that promises a better work-life balance. So how exactly does life change for those who are co-living and living with roommates?…

img.alt_text: photo showing what living with roommates is like in a co-living space

jetpack-related-posts.title: Shared Living Space Guide: Rules For Co Living With The Opposite Sex
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Co living is tough on its own, but if you decide to co live with someone of the opposite sex, it can be tougher. Even if you've co lived with a sibling of the opposite sex when you were home, it's not quite the same when you share an apartment…
